factores-emision-materiales.title: Industrial Material Emission Factors
factores-emision-materiales.shortDescription: Database with cradle-to-gate CO2e emission factors for industrial materials: steel, aluminum, cement, glass and plastics. Includes recycled content and regional origin.

description.paragraph1: World-leading scientific reference database for calculating embodied carbon footprint in construction and industrial materials. Developed by Ecoinvent, the most cited source in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) studies.
description.paragraph2: Emission factors follow ISO 14044 methodology and are segmented by production region, allowing precise calculations based on material origin. Essential for ESG reporting, CSRD compliance and sustainable procurement specifications.

useCases: Carbon footprint calculation for manufactured products
Alternative material comparison in design phase
ESG reporting and CSRD directive compliance

schema.description: kg CO2e per kg of material (cradle-to-gate)

prohibited: Publication of individual factors without context

intensidad-carbono-red.title: Electricity Grid Carbon Intensity
intensidad-carbono-red.shortDescription: Real-time and historical data on electricity grid carbon intensity (gCO2/kWh) for over 150 countries. Complete energy mix.

description.paragraph1: Electricity Maps provides real-time electricity carbon intensity data, allowing companies to make informed decisions about when and where to consume energy to minimize their carbon footprint.
description.paragraph2: The dataset includes the complete energy mix (solar, wind, coal, gas, nuclear, hydro), allowing precise geographic Scope 2 emissions calculation. Essential for sustainable energy procurement strategies.

useCases: Location selection for new factories or data centers
Consumption optimization based on 'clean energy hours'

emisiones-logisticas-modal.title: Logistics Emissions by Transport Mode
emisiones-logisticas-modal.shortDescription: Emission factors for different transport modes (air, sea, road, rail) adjusted by cargo type and distance.

description.paragraph1: GLEC (Global Logistics Emissions Council) framework implemented as API. Provides certified emission factors to calculate freight transport carbon footprint according to ISO 14083 methodology.
description.paragraph2: Includes adjustments for vehicle type, load factor, distance, topography and fuel. Essential for Scope 3 category 4 (upstream transport) and 9 (downstream transport) reporting.

useCases: Modal comparison (road vs rail vs sea)
EcoVadis and CDP Supply Chain reporting
